rComments: Pretty easy class. He is a way chill teacher. I would definitely recommend this if you are looking for something with an easy A.

Steve is a great guy, though I did not learn much in ADV199. The field trip is fun, though we had no grade in the class until the last day of class. Definitely recommend taking a class with him at some point.

Honestly one of the coolest professors you will ever have the chance of meeting. He loves what he does and he loves making lectures fun and interesting. A lot of the test questions are about lecture so it's a good idea to go to class. I never missed a class of his because I loved it so much.

Awesome teacher. Makes lectures fun and it is clear that he wants the students to do well. This class is an easy A if you study for tests and I really enjoyed learning about advertising because of him.

One of my favorite classes. Go to lecture! 80% of the test comes from his lecture examples and definitions. You only have 4 tests (no final) and a project. The tests are very straightforward (he gives very detailed review guides and notes can be found online). He gives a fair amount of extra credit as well. Great class and professor!
This class was great. Easy and fun to go to lecture. Steve is a great professor and offers a lot of extra credit. Tells you everything that's on the test.

He knows his stuff. He's an awesome teacher and makes lectures interesting. I would recommend scheduling office hours with him though, he's a pretty busy guy. Take notes in class and graze over the textbook and you'll be fine.

Steve is an awesome guy and an awesome teacher! He knows so much about the industry and makes lecture interesting. Make sure you take notes in lecture and read the textbook for the tests but don't stress too much because there are extra credit opportunities.
Very interesting course about advertising in general, all the different agencies, and careers in the field. Exams were pretty easy and he's a cool guy.

This class is very easy.  Everything is very straightforward. But this professor is a very bad. Tests are poorly written. What a disgrace for an instructor who does not know how to write a proper exam. Also take very good notes in lecture since he will not post lecture notes online. He only post lecture outlines, which do not cover everything.

Super nice professor and all of the lectures are really entertaining. half of the test is over stuff talked about in class and the other half is from the book, so don't try to get by in this class without either.  He also offers lots of extra credit and take advantage of as much of it as you can, because the small points really add up.

Not an easy A. Loved attending classes he showed great clips, and examples. The test/exams were pretty tricky if you didn't read the book or attend class. But there is tons of extra credit just in case you fail the tests. The assignments/ projects were fairly easy though.

Steve is an awesome teacher. He is very chill and interesting. There are only four tests and a project so in order to do well you must study a lot for the tests. Even though the material is common sense, he finds a way to make the tests difficult.
He's amazing. So funny, really laid back. Never keeps you the whole time. If there's nothing to do in class, he will just cancel it. He's awesome!!!!!

Honestly I hated going to class just cause it was three hours long, but he took that into consideration and would give us breaks. Class mostly consisted of him showing us YouTube clips of commercials, You always had something fun to show friends but you have to really read the textbook to pass the exams. He's pretty cool but all over the place.

Def came out of the class a lot more aware of how advertising shapes my everyday judgment.Exams came with a study guide given usually a week  in advance.Assignments were more toward the end of the semester but overall didn't ask for anything unreasonable as they just required you to think a bit outside the box/creatively. Recommend for advanced hrs

Professor Hall class was interesting. I wouldn't say this is the easiest class i ever taken, because i actually had to spent time reading the text books and notes. However, overall the class was easy, in order to get an A in this class, all you need to do is to study carefully and find out every answer on the study guide, and you will get an A.

I didn't like this guy at all. He wasn't helpful, and in lecture all he does is talk about himself and all the places he's traveled. Plus he name drops a lot. He tends to just skim the important material. You have to really pay attention in lecture and take thorough notes. However, it's not too hard to get a good grade.

Steve knows a lot about the advertising industry, but he rambles. Most of the time you just YouTube ads. The tests are kind of hard because his lecture notes are just examples without real definitions. He is very well connected though, and he's pretty funny.
Super easy class and Steve is awesome! Such a foodie and has traveled everywhere. Very interesting even if you're not an Advertising major!
